column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Nine Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Friday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.  The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 004 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Friday
column5: 549 on Thursday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.There are currently 370 Covid inpatients in hospitals across Northern Ireland
column7: down from 395 on Thursday.There are 33 being treated in intensive care units (ICU)
column8: down from 35 on Wednesday. Last updated 26 November at 14:25 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column10: 203 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Friday.1
column12: 366 of the jabs were first doses
column16: 248 were third doses of the vaccine. The remainder were booster jabs. Last updated 26 November at 14:25 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 4
column17: 620 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Friday
column19: 764 on Thursday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
